main event: A civilian observed an elongated, glowing white object in the sky for three seconds on March 27, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed directly in front of the observer's car at a 45-degree elevation before disappearing at 25 degrees to the northwest., The object was described as being about the size of a grapefruit with a tail half its size., The sighting occurred at dusk in clear and mild weather., The observer was an equipment operator, aged 52, and deemed reliable., The conclusion of the report was that the object was likely a meteor.
sighted object: one elongated, grapefruit-sized glowing white object
